support_summary: Proteomics screens identified the crucial mitophagy receptor Prohibitin 2 (PHB2) as a mitochondrial interacting partner of TDP-43.

functions.cellular_process: TDP-43 interacts with Prohibitin 2 (PHB2), a crucial receptor protein on the inner mitochondrial membrane involved in initiating mitophagy (the selective autophagic clearance of damaged mitochondria).
functions.effect_description: This interaction suggests TDP-43 plays a role in mitochondrial quality control. Overexpression of TDP-43 increases PHB2 levels, while TDP-43 knockdown reduces them, particularly during induced mitophagy. This indicates TDP-43 may be required for an efficient mitophagy response.
biological_consequence: Mitochondrial damage → TDP-43/PHB2 interaction → Efficient mitophagy → Removal of damaged mitochondria → Maintained cellular health
specific_effects: Proteomics screens identified PHB2 as a mitochondrial interacting partner of TDP-43.
TDP-43 overexpression leads to an increase in PHB2, while its knockdown reduces PHB2 expression during CCCP-induced mitophagy.
The interaction between TDP-43 and PHB2 suggests a role for TDP-43 in Parkin-mediated mitophagy.

evidence.paper_title: TDP-43 interacts with mitochondrial proteins critical for mitophagy and mitochondrial dynamics
TDP-43 proteinopathy and mitochondrial abnormalities in neurodegeneration

mechanism: TDP-43 interacts with Prohibitin 2 (PHB2), a crucial receptor protein on the inner mitochondrial membrane involved in initiating mitophagy (the selective autophagic clearance of damaged mitochondria).
effect: This interaction suggests TDP-43 plays a role in mitochondrial quality control. Overexpression of TDP-43 increases PHB2 levels, while TDP-43 knockdown reduces them, particularly during induced mitophagy. This indicates TDP-43 may be required for an efficient mitophagy response.
summary: TDP43 activates PHB2 to modulate mitophagy, ultimately affecting maintained cellular health.

evidence.paper_title: TDP-43 interacts with mitochondrial proteins critical for mitophagy and mitochondrial dynamics
TDP-43 proteinopathy and mitochondrial abnormalities in neurodegeneration
